do you have a 3d party repo added that provides mono?
what thats about is you have a package mono-addins that has that file in it. when dpkg gets ready to install a new package, it checks to be sure it's not overwriting a file from another package.
so someone didn't write their package to follow the ubuntu file structure.
remove mono-addins ,
apt-cache policy mono-addins will tell you what repo it's from
apt-get remove --purge mono-addins . You might find it trying to remove some other packages that were installed from the 3d party repo as well
